intro: Psychotria mitis, commonly known as the "white psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Psychotria mitis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
